title: Pics of walk through seats wtd

posts.content:
Hiya all.
Has anyone got their walk through seats out of their bus at the moment?
I'm after some pics from all angles please. Its the adjustable drivers type I'm after. I'm keen to know if they follow the contour of the wheel tub.
If you pm me I'll give my mail addy over to save getting them hosted.
Cheers. Steve

Hi mate
I took the front seats out of my LHD 66 recently and have some pictures of they would help
Are they the clip-in type or the one piece with the adjustable driver seat? Steve
Driver is one piece on a slider, passenger is clip in 2 pieces

i have a walktrough driver seat frame standing.
gonna try to take some pictures of it tomorrow.

henk!!!
Thanks for that henk. More the merrier. When you are looking for seats it a good idea to know what they look like!

not easy to take pictures off just a frame,
hope this is what you want;

henk!!!

Ah, many thanks for that henk. Those pics are magic mate. It will also let a lot of other members know what they are looking for when they purchase a walk through bus with no seats. There are, of course, the other type that just clip into "U" brackets and don't have any adjustment.
Many members have questions on the subject of what else you could use in place of the very rare and expensive walk through seats. Early bay seats aren't too bad as they are quite shallow but I've made some long trips in buses with higher seat bases and its a bit of a pain with your head rubbing the roof for a hundred miles! Steve

no probleme,
i am also looking for the passenger side seat that fits tn the "U" brackets.
normally i should have the upper parts soon and so i just looking for the seat base to complete everything.
but you don't need the expensive "walktrough" seat for the driver side.
the ones from a splitscreen that have a bench seat that is diveded in a bench for 2 passengers and a adjustable single seat for the driver is exactly thje same seat as driver walktrough seat.

henk!!!
So what is your bus...LHD or RHD?

What year?
That is a standard drivers seat which will fit either LHD or RHD.
AHS sell the seat runner brackets for fitting to the wheel tub to suit both hands.
So that is the driver seated!
The passenger seat base is formed to be shallow by the door with a deeper section by the WT gap...

A couple of years ago I bought a pair of walk through seats, all with new covers on them (for my 66 RHD bus), and they are in as new condition. So I was very pleased to find them. They cost me Â£500 but as I say, they are in really nice condition. They are the clip-in type.
The thing is, I would like the driver seat to have some adjustment on it, so I was thinking of buying the runners and searching for the seat.
So here I am, learning about walk through seats! If the standard adjustable driver seat will fit both buses, it may be easier than I thought.

To add a bit to the "alternative" idea of using bay seats. If you aren't sitting at the correct height you may experience a bit of pain in the upper back and neck. I've had a bit of this and I can tell you, its not good when you are on a long drive.

So, I have a driver seat for a RHD bus (the clip-in type) that I would like to change for an adjustable type seat.
Steve

i learned here as well that pre '63 walktroughs has fixed seats on both sides after that it is fixed passenger seat and the driver seat on sliders.
it makes it a bit easier to find a seat then if it is not just has to be from a walktrough.

henk!!!

The 67 RHD WT was two piece fixed seats on both sides...
Confirmed by Matt D on his bus...
I believe there are still three positions for the base to allow the driver to sit near or far from the wheel...
G
